Given your preference for war films and interest in intriguing stories, I'd highly recommend "Apocalypse Now" directed by Francis Ford Coppola. Set during the Vietnam War, this film follows a U.S. Army officer on a dangerous mission to assassinate a renegade colonel. It features an impressive cast including Marlon Brando and Martin Sheen.

Another captivating choice could be "A Bridge Too Far," a historical drama about Operation Market Garden in World War II. Starring an all-star cast like Sean Connery, Ryan O'Neal, and Dirk Bogarde, it tells the story of the Allies attempting to capture several strategic bridges in the Netherlands.
